intro: Cuatrecasanthus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, fibrous pods, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
